intro: Cistanthe floresiorum, commonly known as the Flores Island cistanthe, is a flowering plant native to the island of Flores in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or rocky crevices. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often covered in a fine layer of silky hairs. Cistanthe floresiorum is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and limited geographic distribution.
